snippet: Turkey has suspended many of its ties to France since passage of the bill concerning the killings of Armenians by Ottoman Turkish troops during World War I.
abstract: France's Constitutional Council says it will rule on the constitutionality of bill that criminalizes the denial of the Armenian genocide, following appeals signed by dozens of lawmakers from across the political spectrum; legislation, which has been assailed by the Turkish government, has passed both houses of Parliament, but has not yet been signed into law by President Nicolas Sarkozy.

byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: Turkey has suspended many of its ties to France since passage of the bill concerning the killings of Armenians by Ottoman Turkish troops during World War I.

headline.seo: French Court to Rule on Armenian Genocide Legislation
headline.main: French Court to Review Genocide Bill
headline.print_headline: French Court To Review Genocide Bill

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
